name: Andrew Clifford
title: President
bio: Andrew Clifford started information technology work in 1981 developing accounting applications. He consulted for 20 years on financial trading systems in the City of London: at several equities trading firms. For ten years he was technical manager for one major system which, at its peak, handled 1% of the shares traded globally. He left the City in 2010 to become a writer, then learned about Bitcoin in late-2012. Since then he has been immersed in community efforts to help this cryptocurrency develop towards translating the world economy onto a sound monetary system in order to improve living standards everywhere.

name: Andrew Stone
title: Lead Developer
bio: Andrew Stone is the lead developer for Bitcoin Unlimited.

Andrew produced video game development software (Game-Maker) in 1991 which sold in 3 countries (US, GB, and South Korea). He graduated with a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science from Yale University in 1995. He then worked at a number of telecom startups including Ascom Nexion (acquired by Fujitsu Network Communications for $130m), Ignitus Communications (acquired by Lucent fro $240m), and Camiant Inc. (acquired by Tekelec for $130m).

Andrew then led engineering at OpenClovis Inc whose high-availability clustering software is deployed worldwide. He also produced hardware and software for an Arduino-compatible embedded LED drive (Lightuino) that was directly sold worldwide and was used in interior design prototype automobiles for BMW and Rolls-Royce.
Andrew was introduced to and invested in Bitcoin in 2012.

name: Dr. Peter Rizun
title: Secretary / Chief Scientist
bio: Peter R. Rizun is a physicist and entrepreneur living in Vancouver, Canada, and is co-founder and co-managing editor for Ledger. His main research interest is developing analytical theory that explains properties and emergent phenomenon of the Bitcoin Network. He has written two papers related to Bitcoin that received significant interest, "A Transaction Fee Market Exists Without A Block Size Limit" and "Reduce Orphaning Risk and Improve Zero Confirmation Security With Subchains", and gave a talk on block space as an economic commodity at the Scaling Bitcoin conference in Montreal. He was the recipient of the $105,000 Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC) CGS Doctoral Award and was recognized as a "Leader of Tomorrow" by the Alberta Science and Technology Foundation (ASTech). He holds a B.A.Sc. degree in Engineering Physics from the University of British Columbia and a Ph.D. in Medical Physics from the University of Calgary.

name: Andrea Suisani
title: Key Developer
bio: A software developer for almost twenty years, recently transitioned to what they use to call a full-stack software developer. That means doing 4 jobs while being payed only for one. On the bright side such a role gives opportunity to improve skills through a lot of IT fields like database system administration, system administration, coding and project management.
Holding a Bachelor degree in statistics, and getting into Bitcoin in 2011, Andrea briefly pool mined with a Radeon GPU, and hasn't looked back since.

name: Peter Tschipper
title: Key Developer
bio: Peter Tschipper is a full time Bitcoin Unlimited developer living on Vancouver Island, Canada. Peter holds a degree in Engineering from the University of Toronto and has worked in the areas of Finance, Health Care and Mineral Exploration. Most of his tech experiences are in the field of Performance Engineering and his main interest is in applying that knowledge to further the goal of Bitcoin On-Chain scaling.

name: Roger Ver
title: CEO Bitcoin.com / BU member
bio: After founding several successful companies in Silicon Valley, Roger began his Bitcoin journey in February 2011.

Years before traditional venture capital firms became involved, he became the first person in the world to start investing in Bitcoin related startups, nearly singlehandedly funded the entire first generation of Bitcoin businesses.
His current investments include Bitcoin.com, Blockchain.com, Bitpay.com, Kraken.com, and many many others.
In his free time he enjoys competing in Brazilian Jujitsu tournaments.

name: Dr. Christopher Wilmer
title: University Liaison
bio: Prof. Christopher E. Wilmer began using Bitcoin in September 2011, after reading Wired Magazine's infamous article entitled "The Rise and Fall of Bitcoin." Undeterred by Wired's confident view that the Bitcoin experiment was over, Chris bought some bitcoins for $3 each and began learning to use this exciting new technology. In 2014, he co-authored his first book on Bitcoin aimed at the general public, "Bitcoin for the Befuddled," and also started the world's first academic journal for Bitcoin/cryptocurrency related research, called Ledger.

Prof. Wilmer directs a research lab at the University of Pittsburgh that uses large-scale molecular simulations, run on supercomputers, to understand and design new materials. His research group works closely with experimental chemists and materials scientists to synthesize and test promising materials. In 2012 he co-founded NuMat Technologies and was named by Forbes as one of the 30-Under-30 in Energy Innovation. Recently he was awarded an early career fellowship for promising scientists and engineers from the US National Science Foundation.

name: Haipo Yang
title: CEO ViaBTC / BU member
bio: Haipo Yang is ViaBTC's founder and CEO.

Haipo got to know Bitcoin in 2011, began his investments in 2013, and founded ViaBTC in May 2016. He has grown ViaBTC to be one of the largest and most advanced mining pools globally. An experienced developer, he independently set up the technical infrastructure for the pool and took it from 0 to 1.

name: Jerry Chan
title: Strategist
bio: Jerry Chan is a financial technologist who has worked on Wall Street trading technology at Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan for a total of 14 years. Jerry is editor of the crypto-currency blog WallStreetTechnologist.com and works on various Bitcoin related projects around Asia, the most recent of which is Satoricoin.jp the first customizable physical bitcoin aimed at the mass market. Jerry holds a degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Waterloo, Canada.
